title: Wormhole-inspired teleportation (WIT)
description: The WIT benchmark schema definition, describing the Wormhole-inspired teleportation benchmark configuration.

benchmark_name.description: Name of the benchmark. Must be 'WIT' for this schema.

shots.description: Number of measurement shots (repetitions) to use for the benchmark.

n_qubits_per_side.description: Number of qubits on each side of the thermofield double state.

message_size.description: Number of qubits used to encode the teleported message. Only 1 is currently supported for swap/transfer insertion.

insert_message_method.description: Technique used to inject the message into the left subsystem.

interaction_coupling_strength.description: Interaction coupling strength (g) applied during the two-sided coupling step.

x_rotation_transverse_angle.description: Transverse X rotation angle (b) applied in each Hamiltonian step.

zz_rotation_angle.description: ZZ rotation angle (J) applied in each Hamiltonian step.

z_rotation_angles.description: List of single-qubit Z rotation angles h_i. Must have length equal to n_qubits_per_side.

time_steps.description: Number of Hamiltonian evolution steps (kicks) applied on each side.

num_qubits.description: Optional legacy field for compatibility with fixed circuits. When provided it must match the total number of qubits implied by the other parameters.
